CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 12, 1958, page A2, reads: "The Mayor Breaks Ground - With silver pick and shovel, Mayor David L. Lawrence breaks ground with A. N. Brion at the new site of the Greyhound Bus Terminal, due for completion next year. The Mayor wields the shovel, while Mr. Brion, president of the Eastern Division of greyhound uses a pick. Looking on is Pat Navarro of the Navarro Corporation, contracting firm. The handsome new building, with public parking space for over 176 cars will front on 11th St. at Liberty Ave. - Harris Photo."David Leo Lawrence was Mayor of Pittsburgh from 1946 to 1958, and Governor of Pennsylvania from 1959 to 1963. He died in 1966.
TitMainTitle: President of Eastern Division of Greyhound Bus A. N. Brion swinging pickaxe, Pittsburgh Mayor David L. Lawrence with shovel, and Pat Navarro gathered in front of bus at site of new Greyhound bus station, 11th Street and Liberty Avenue, Strip District
